description: As protests over the Israel Hamas war roil college campuses across the U.S., similar protests are happening elsewhere in the world. We hear from some of them. And a quirky festival in Colombia celebrates the donkey.
title: Israel Hamas War Protests Worldwide; Visiting a Donkey Festival in Colombia

description: When marijuana becomes a Schedule III instead of a Schedule I substance under federal rules, researchers will face fewer barriers to studying it. But there will still be some roadblocks for science.
title: Scientists welcome new rules on marijuana, but research will still face obstacles

description: It is "the first known case of active wound treatment in a wild animal with a medical plant," biologist Isabelle Laumer told NPR. She says the orangutan, called Rakus, is now thriving.
title: Orangutan in the wild applied medicinal plant to heal its own injury, biologists say

description: Katie Ledecky is used to getting medals, having earned 10 at the Olympics. But on Friday she received the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the highest award a civilian can get from the U.S. government.
title: Katie Ledecky tells NPR about her plans for the Paris Olympics — and L.A. in 2028

description: Students in the U.K., France and Mexico have sought to erect what many of them call "solidarity encampments," prompting a variety of responses from university authorities and local law enforcement.
title: Campus protests over the war in Gaza have gone international

description: Wally has many fans in Pennsylvania and across social media. His owner is enlisting their help, saying Wally was kidnapped, located by a trapper and released into a swamp while vacationing in Georgia.
title: Have you seen this emotional support gator? Wally's owner says he's lost in Georgia

description: Siblings — especially twins — sometimes share the strangest traits, like throwing a ball with their head or picking up keys and crayons with their toes. Researchers want to know whqt's up with that.
title: Siblings can share the darndest quirks — like picking up coins & keys with their toes

description: For decades, nonprofits, health insurers and hospitals have been trying to solve the problem of the people who need the emergency room again and again. Here are some of the lessons they've learned.
title: How do you help patients who show up in the ER 100 times a year?

description: Google's landmark antitrust lawsuit wraps today. Steve Inskeep celebrates 20 years as Morning Edition host. After a week of silence, Biden addresses the pro-Palestinian protests on college campuses.
title: Google antitrust lawsuit closes; Steve Inskeep celebrates 20 years at Morning Edition

description: The 10% drop in year-over-year iPhone sales for the January-March period is latest sign of weakness in a product that generates most of Apple's revenue.
title: Apple shows its steepest quarterly decline in iPhone sales since pandemic's outset

description: Michael Sanchez was testing out his new camera when he happened upon a feathered subject. The blue rock-thrush he photographed on the coast of northern Oregon last week has excited the birding world.
title: Hobbyist photographer snaps photo of extremely rare bird in 1st U.S. sighting

description: President Biden is giving the nation's highest civilian honor to 19 people, a list that includes civil rights leaders, trailblazers and an unusually large contingent of high-profile Democrats.
title: Biden is giving the Medal of Freedom to a who's who of Democrats (and Katie Ledecky)

description: Four states so far have passed laws prohibiting the use of public money for no-strings cash aid. Advocates for basic income say the backlash is being fueled by a conservative think tank.
title: After a boom in cash aid to tackle poverty, some states are now banning it

description: The bill which was previously passed in the House in 2019 and 2022, but blocked in the Senate, aims to end race-based hair discrimination in schools and workplaces.
title: Black lawmakers reintroduce federal CROWN Act legislation to ban hair discrimination

description: What a new bridge over Baltimore's Patapsco River will look like is still very much a matter of speculation. But one design stands out.
title: Bridge projects across U.S. offer clues to what may replace Baltimore's fallen span

description: Federal health officials say the U.S. has the building blocks to make a vaccine to protect humans from bird flu, if needed. But experts warn we're nowhere near prepared for another pandemic.
title: Launching an effective bird flu vaccine quickly could be tough, scientists warn

description: Where's the beef? What's the deal with marijuana? Why does this read like a '90s stand-up script? The answer to at least some of these questions can be found in the quiz. Were you paying attention?
title: Which celebrity feud escalated this week? Find out in the news quiz

description: The state's law requires women seeking divorce to disclose whether they're pregnant — and state judges won't finalize divorces during a pregnancy. Texas and Arkansas have similar laws on the books.
title: Pregnant women in Missouri can't get divorced. Critics say it fuels domestic violence

description: The government described the step as the "second phase" of measures against Israel, adding the steps would remain in force until Israel allows a "sufficient flow of humanitarian aid to Gaza."
title: Turkey halts all trade with Israel over military actions in Gaza

description: The Sept. 2, 2019, blaze was the deadliest maritime disaster in recent U.S. history, and prompted changes to maritime regulations, congressional reform and several ongoing lawsuits.
title: Captain sentenced to 4 years in fiery deaths of 34 aboard scuba boat in California
